title: Can technology ever take place of teachers? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. It's true to say that the sales forces of every technology company since the development of the wire recorder has claimed this. And it's true to say that governments would love to replace all their expensive and awkward teachers with simple capital purchases of the latest tech. But the problem is, human beings are still on software 0.9c and don't tend to learn very well things they're not currently that interested in without another human being present to keep them in task and with minimal disruption. Teachers will be needed, schools and classrooms will be needed despite what Apple and Google would like to sell you for at least the next dozen generations.

Yes technology can take the place of teachers for a few students that do not want to be socially engaged. Many of the best teachers are socially invested and make connections with their students. School as a whole can be very social for the average student. Schools do a lot more than just depart knowledge into students. I would hate to be a part of a society that has all its students learn via technology. Humans as a species are social. What would fill that social gap?

Technology can replace teacher - bad teachers. Teachers that are tape recorders and teach the same thing in a loop year after year. Technology cannot replace a good teacher. A good teacher is knowledge that can be shared to every mind sitting in the class without differentiation. The ability to teach is gift that only a few possess. In my lifetime of sitting in classes, good teachers are hard to come by! Most of the teachers are just recordings of previous lectures. Internet can replace every single teacher in every single classroom and college in India without any exception. All you need to teach a student is the language, and the tools required to research and leave him with an aptitude for eternal research and he would never need a teacher ever in his life again. Teachers must be made obsolete, they have become obsolete but we are not willing to give up our old methods of teaching. The class room has become obsolete, the lessons have become obsolete and the teacher by the logic of induction has become obsolete. The teaching systems have become outdated. The schools can’t keep up with the progress of technology anymore. It is not a radical thought anymore that we don’t need teachers!

No. Technology can show us what parts of teaching can be replaced or augmented — but in general, it shows why teachers are so important (and how they can be even more effective with technology!). For example, just because Duolingo can help get you started learning a language…. that doesn’t mean you don’t need a tutor. In fact, many students find that after learning with it and passing several levels, they NEED a teacher to both confirm their past learning as well take them to the higher more abstract levels. At TutorMandarin, we use real Chinese teachers still for all levels. Plus, with the advanced technology of our virtual classroom, now students can learn from all over the world as if they have their own private Chinese tutor right on call. Heck, businesses are starting all the time with platforms like this.

Not true, technology is merely an enhancement to the learning process. Machines are not capable of what humans are, they can do many things and do them faster and without mistakes, but teachers are teaching much more than what a machine/technology can such as social skills, humor, relating previous experiences and much more. Just think of what they said when calculators replaced slide rulers for engineers. You might have to research what a slide ruler is, but believe it or not, we didn’t always have calculators.

Well, Technology basically means internet. But teachers are real life tutors. They can understand your situation and feelings. Yet technology can’t really get what your’e thinking. Technology only gives you results of the question you search on Google or other websites. But teachers can mentor you, they can help you out in many things. Think about the people who worked hard for years to get a job, and if you replace them with other stuffs then it can make a big wastage of those people’s time. But in the other hand, we also need technology. So I think it’s better to have a teacher to teach you in the first place and you can have technology also, as it can help in many things too.

With billions waisted through the federal education administration , their time is up comon core was the last straw.

Yes, but depends on how the teacher you are talking about is.If the teacher is loving his job he must be replaced if he or she loves his profession ,no replacement of him or her can be ever found.Fully depends on the definition of Job and Profession known by that person.
You tell me: are most human being naturally inclined and motivated to learn complex concepts and skills on their own? I have yet to see any evidence of that.
No. It is not a technology who taught us to read , it's a TEACHER who taught us to read. So, A teacher is always a teacher. Nothing can replace a teacher.

It is easier to learn anything with a teacher. Are there bad teachers? Yes. So, a better answer is, “It is easier to learn anything with a good teacher.” I’ll even go so far as to say, “The better the teacher, the easier it is to learn the subject.” The above is not to say, the student doesn’t have to do any work, the student has to study the material the student wants to master.
